titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Letters to William Toynbee
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday November 29, 2018 at 04:23
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: 113 letters to William Toynbee from such correspondents as Helen Paterson Allingham, Edward Montagu Butler, Lewis Harcourt, Frederic Harrison, Alfred Milner, Elizabeth Robins, and Anne Douglas Sedgwick. There also two letters written by others to others about William Toynbee.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn, 1951.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Letters to William Toynbee collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Letters to William Toynbee. General Collection. Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing card set in the Manuscripts Catalog, or from another inventory. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained. If the collection also contains unlisted or unsorted material, this has been noted in the box-and-folder list.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 113 letters to William Toynbee from such correspondents as Helen Paterson Allingham, Edward Montagu Butler, Lewis Harcourt, Frederic Harrison, Alfred Milner, Elizabeth Robins, and Anne Douglas Sedgwick. There also two letters written by others to others about William Toynbee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by calling card, with note on verso

did.unittitle: Boucicault, Dion G. ALS and TLS, [London?]
Butler, Edward Montagu. 9 ALS, Harrow on the Hill
Clarendon, George Herbert Hyde Villiers. TLS, [London]
du Maurier, Mrs. E. ALS, London
Du Pontet, Clement Adolphe Auguste. ALS, Harrow School
Frampton, George James. 2 ALS, St. John's Wood
Hall, Sydney Prior. ALS, Haverstock Hill
Hearn, Walter Risley. ALS, Kensington Court
Hervey, Arthur. ALS, Hyde Park, W.
Kilbracken, Arthur Godley. ALS, Tunbridge Wells
Knollys, Edward George William Tyrwhitt. 2 TLS, Sandringham, Norfolk
Knutsford, Arthur Henry Holland-Hibbert. ALS, London
La Panouse, vicomtesse de. ALS, London
Lyall, Charles James. ALS, Cornwall Gardens
Macready, Cecil Frederick Nevil. ALS, Fontainebleau
Ormsby-Gore, William George Arthur. TLS, Westminster
Parsons, Alfred. 2 ALS, Kensington, U.S.M.S. "St. Louis"
Robins, Elizabeth. 2 ALS, [London?], St. James Theatre
Roseberry, Albert Edward Harry Meyer Archibald Primrose. TL, Edinburgh
Sedgwick, Anne Douglas. 4 ALS, various places
Sichel, Edith Helen. ALS, Hambledon Hurst, Godalming, Surrey
Somerset, C. W. ALS, Avenue Theatre
Teipiel, G. F. de. 2 ALS, Chichester
Wilson, Guy Douglas Arthur Fleetwood. ALS, [London]
Winnington-Ingram, Arthur Foley. ALS, Fulham Palace
Zetland, Lawrence John Lumley Dundas. ALS, Hill Cottage, Newmarket
Monson, Edmund John. ALS to the president of the Royal Indian College of Engineering [Sir George Chesney] about William Toynbee, [London]
Wyndham, Charles. TNS to Theyre Smith, [London]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The note concerns a play of William Toynbee
